intro: Zootrophion antioquianum, commonly known as the Antioquian zootrophion, is a rare flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It belongs to the family Zingiberaceae, which includes ginger and turmeric, and is characterized by its ornate, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has a unique morphology with long, narrow leaves. Its botanical significance lies in its limited distribution and potential medicinal properties that are currently under study.
